page.name: Incorporating Relevant TopicsÂ
page.content:
Educators can make content relevant by providing tasks that allow for active participation and choice, and by focusing on content that directly connects to learners' lives. 

For example, adult learners report being very interested in reading news stories and staying abreast of current happenings. Educators could allow readers to select, read, and share an article they are interested in from sites that use language appropriate for the learners' reading levels. Remember, no matter the learners' "reading level," the content matters, and educators need to make sure they are providing meaningful and relevant information that adult learners care about. When it comes to teaching literacy, content matters. Engage students with topics they care about, while building the background knowledge and vocabulary they need to become active, engaged readers.
